alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 10:15PM MDT until May 12 at 2:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in Colorado... Fountain Creek Near Fountain Creek near Fountain affecting El Paso County. Fountain Creek At Colorado Springs affecting El Paso County. For the Fountain Creek...including Colorado Springs, Fountain Creek near Fountain, Pinon, Pueblo...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fountain Creek At Colorado Springs. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Homeless encampment below and near the Nevada Avenue bridge is affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 11.7 feet late this evening. It will then fall just after midnight tonight. It will rise to 11.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.7 feet on 04/30/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1015 AM MDT.
